# Arpeggio: Diminished in D

## Brief Presentation
An arpeggio is a musical technique where the notes of a chord are played individually instead of simultaneously. A diminished arpeggio is a chord made up of a root note, a minor third, and a diminished fifth. In the key of D, a diminished arpeggio would consist of the notes D, F, and Ab.

## Notes and Intervals
- D (root note)
- F (minor third)
- Ab (diminished fifth)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
Diminished arpeggios are often used in various genres such as jazz, metal, and classical music. They have a dark and tense sound due to the dissonant intervals in the chord. Diminished arpeggios are great for creating tension and adding color to musical passages.

## Songs

1. "Black Sabbath" by Black Sabbath - The main riff of this classic heavy metal song features a prominent diminished arpeggio in D.
2. "Blue Monk" by Thelonious Monk - This jazz standard uses diminished arpeggios throughout the composition, offering a unique harmonic color.
